## PHQ-9 vs SHAPS

Modern psychology and social science involves extensive use of questionnaires for assessment purposes. Far too often, psychologists find themselves needing to compare and draw parallels between different questionnaires, such as the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9) and Snaith Hamilton Pleasure Scale (SHAPS). Harmonising items between such questionnaires is a time-consuming and subjective process. Harmony, a state-of-the-art software solution, offers a streamlined solution for the harmonisation of PHQ-9 vs SHAPS. The comparison between PHQ-9 and SHAPS is no longer a daunting task thanks to Harmony. This tool relies on natural language processing and generative AI models to find matches between questionnaire items, even if they are in different languages. By using Harmony's large language model, you'll be able to determine a percentage match between each item in the PHQ-9 and SHAPS, thus enabling a more objective and efficient harmonisation process. Try the dynamic Harmony software for PHQ-9 vs SHAPS comparison. Easily select from Harmony's vast database of instruments or upload your own questionnaires in PDF format through Harmony's intuitive web interface. Efficiency, accuracy, and thoroughness are increasingly crucial in psychological research and assessment, and the comparison of PHQ-9 vs SHAPS has never been easier. Try Harmony now and experience the transformative potential of AI for psychological questionnaire comparison.

## Compare the items in PHQ-9 and SHAPS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import PHQ-9 and SHAPS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just PHQ-9 into Harmony</a> - compare PHQ-9 with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SHAPS into Harmony</a> - compare SHAPS with other instruments
